data: 1 00:00:18,309 --> 00:00:20,978 First there was darkness. 2 00:00:22,021 --> 00:00:24,732 Then came the strangers. 3 00:00:24,815 --> 00:00:28,235 They were a race as old as time itself. 4 00:00:28,319 --> 00:00:31,030 They had mastered the ultimate technology... 5 00:00:31,113 --> 00:00:34,032 the ability to alter physical reality... 6 00:00:34,116 --> 00:00:36,368 by will alone. 7 00:00:36,452 --> 00:00:39,455 They called this ability "tuning." 8 00:00:40,498 --> 00:00:42,374 But they were dying. 9 00:00:42,458 --> 00:00:45,002 Their civilization was in decline... 10 00:00:45,086 --> 00:00:48,089 and so they abandoned their world... 11 00:00:48,172 --> 00:00:51,800 seeking a cure for their own mortality. 12 00:00:51,884 --> 00:00:55,637 Their endless journey brought them to a small blue world... 13 00:00:55,721 --> 00:00:58,807 in the farthest corner of the galaxy... 14 00:00:58,891 --> 00:01:01,351 our world. 15 00:01:01,435 --> 00:01:03,770 Here they thought they had finally found... 16 00:01:03,854 --> 00:01:05,814 what they had been searching for. 17 00:01:16,117 --> 00:01:19,787 My name is Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber. 18 00:01:19,870 --> 00:01:21,621 I am just a man. 19 00:01:21,706 --> 00:01:24,875 I help the strangers conduct their experiments. 20 00:01:25,876 --> 00:01:29,796 I have betrayed my own kind. 21 00:03:26,872 --> 00:03:27,998 Uhh! 22 00:04:55,461 --> 00:04:58,338 You are confused, aren't you? Frightened. 23 00:04:58,422 --> 00:05:00,340 That's all right. I can help you. 24 00:05:00,424 --> 00:05:01,341 Who is this? 25 00:05:01,425 --> 00:05:03,427 I am a doctor. Now, you must listen to me. 26 00:05:03,511 --> 00:05:06,138 You have lost your memory. There was an experiment. 27 00:05:06,222 --> 00:05:08,057 Something went wrong. Your memory was erased. 28 00:05:08,140 --> 00:05:09,391 Do you understand me? 29 00:05:09,475 --> 00:05:11,411 No, I don't understand. What the hell is going on here? 30 00:05:11,435 --> 00:05:14,020 Just listen. There are people coming for you even as we speak. 31 00:05:14,104 --> 00:05:17,524 You must not let them find you. You must leave now. 32 00:05:17,608 --> 00:05:20,402 Hello? Are you there? 33 00:06:01,610 --> 00:06:04,404 Hey, Mr. Murdoch. The Automat called. 34 00:06:04,488 --> 00:06:07,032 Said you left your wallet there. 35 00:06:07,116 --> 00:06:10,410 I suggest you retrieve it since you only paid for 3 weeks... 36 00:06:10,494 --> 00:06:12,579 and they was up 10 minutes ago. 37 00:06:14,164 --> 00:06:16,124 I've been here 3 weeks? 38 00:06:16,208 --> 00:06:18,960 It's right there in black and white, Mr. Murdoch. 39 00:06:19,044 --> 00:06:21,129 Day and date. 40 00:06:21,213 --> 00:06:24,424 We make our books like we make our beds, all neat and tidy. 41 00:06:24,508 --> 00:06:26,843 I'll take care of it when I get back. 42 00:06:26,927 --> 00:06:29,387 See that you do. Only thing makes you a guest... 43 00:06:29,471 --> 00:06:31,764 In this joint, pal, is cash on the barrelhead. 44 00:06:49,658 --> 00:06:52,369 House rules. 3 weeks is 3 weeks. 45 00:06:52,453 --> 00:06:55,998 No days off for good behavior. 46 00:06:56,081 --> 00:06:57,207 Uhh! 47 00:07:05,382 --> 00:07:09,511 Mr. Murdoch, yes, where is he? 48 00:07:09,595 --> 00:07:13,098 He... he just left not 5 minutes ago. 49 00:07:14,433 --> 00:07:16,351 Sleep now. 50 00:07:18,604 --> 00:07:18,687 ♪ When marimba rhythms start to play ♪ 51 00:07:18,688 --> 00:07:22,899 ♪ When marimba rhythms start to play ♪ 52 00:07:22,983 --> 00:07:24,776 ♪ Dance with me ♪ 53 00:07:24,860 --> 00:07:27,654 a“ Make me sway a“ 54 00:07:27,738 --> 00:07:31,825 ♪ Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore ♪ 55 00:07:31,909 --> 00:07:34,119 ♪ Hold me close ♪ 56 00:07:34,203 --> 00:07:37,206 a“ Sway me more a“ 57 00:07:37,289 --> 00:07:41,501 ♪ Like a flower bending in the breeze ♪ 58 00:07:41,585 --> 00:07:43,962 ♪ Bend with me ♪ 59 00:07:44,046 --> 00:07:46,673 ♪ Sway with ease ♪ 60 00:07:46,757 --> 00:07:50,677 ♪ When we dance you have a way with me ♪ 61 00:07:50,761 --> 00:07:53,180 ♪ Stay with me ♪ 62 00:07:53,263 --> 00:07:56,057 ♪ Sway with me ♪ 63 00:07:56,809 --> 00:07:58,185 Hey, sweetie! 64 00:07:58,268 --> 00:08:00,645 He said he was your husband's doctor. 65 00:08:00,729 --> 00:08:03,022 He wanted to speak with you. 66 00:08:21,959 --> 00:08:23,251 Excuse me. 67 00:08:25,587 --> 00:08:26,671 Dr. Sh... 68 00:08:26,755 --> 00:08:29,758 Schreber. Please, won't you come in? 69 00:08:29,842 --> 00:08:31,885 You must be Emma Murdoch. 70 00:08:31,969 --> 00:08:35,639 Thank you for coming to see me on such short notice. 71 00:08:35,723 --> 00:08:37,683 What is this? 72 00:08:37,766 --> 00:08:39,392 A rather crude experiment... 73 00:08:39,476 --> 00:08:41,311 designed to further my studies. 74 00:08:41,395 --> 00:08:44,689 I don't understand. You say you're my husband's doctor... 75 00:08:44,773 --> 00:08:47,650 but he never mentioned you to me. 76 00:08:47,735 --> 00:08:49,027 The truth is, Mrs. Murdoch... 77 00:08:49,111 --> 00:08:51,530 John has been coming to see me for quite some time. 78 00:08:51,613 --> 00:08:55,283 He had been grappling with feelings of betrayal... 79 00:08:55,367 --> 00:08:58,453 stemming from your marital difficulties. 80 00:08:58,537 --> 00:09:01,706 John told you what happened? Yes. 81 00:09:01,790 --> 00:09:04,042 When was the last time that you saw him? 82 00:09:04,126 --> 00:09:05,544 3 weeks ago. 83 00:09:05,627 --> 00:09:09,339 He packed a suitcase. He was very angry at me. 84 00:09:09,423 --> 00:09:12,384 I understand how difficult this must be for you. 85 00:09:12,468 --> 00:09:14,887 But for John's sake, I would like you... 86 00:09:14,970 --> 00:09:16,429 to think of me as your friend, Emma. 87 00:09:16,513 --> 00:09:20,225 It appears that John has suffered a psychotic break. 88 00:09:20,309 --> 00:09:22,102 Complete memory loss. 89 00:09:22,186 --> 00:09:23,604 You can't be serious. 90 00:09:23,687 --> 00:09:26,648 Oh, but I am. He may be delusional. 91 00:09:26,732 --> 00:09:29,276 Even violent. 92 00:09:29,359 --> 00:09:32,653 If he were to contact you, you must call me immediately. 93 00:09:32,738 --> 00:09:35,782 Wherever your husband is, he is searching... 94 00:09:37,409 --> 00:09:38,868 ...for himself. 95 00:09:48,754 --> 00:09:50,922 Good evening, Mr. Murdoch. 96 00:09:51,006 --> 00:09:53,717 It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it? 97 00:09:53,801 --> 00:09:57,679 Mr... Was it "♪... something... Murdoch?" 98 00:10:00,599 --> 00:10:01,766 J. Murdoch. 99 00:10:01,850 --> 00:10:05,311 What's your name? Justin? Jerry? 100 00:10:05,395 --> 00:10:06,938 No. 101 00:10:09,066 --> 00:10:11,109 My name's Jason Murdoch. John Murdoch. 102 00:10:11,193 --> 00:10:12,569 Jake Murdoch. How's it going? 103 00:10:12,653 --> 00:10:13,779 Hi. Jack Murdoch. 104 00:10:13,862 --> 00:10:16,322 Ha ha ha ha! 105 00:10:17,282 --> 00:10:18,741 Hi. 106 00:10:19,952 --> 00:10:21,995 Gotta get a grip on myself. 107 00:10:46,019 --> 00:10:49,147 I told the guy cash on the barrelhead. 108 00:10:49,231 --> 00:10:52,651 I said, "Listen, 3 weeks is 3 weeks." 109 00:10:52,734 --> 00:10:56,779 Where's our lucky winner? Upstairs, sir, room, uh, 614. 110 00:10:56,864 --> 00:10:59,575 Another call girl. 111 00:10:59,658 --> 00:11:02,202 "J. Murdoch." 112 00:11:03,370 --> 00:11:06,414 Evening, Husselbeck. Inspector Bumstead. 113 00:11:06,498 --> 00:11:09,000 Your lace is untied. 114 00:11:09,084 --> 00:11:10,752 Sir. 115 00:11:15,632 --> 00:11:18,343 ...exactly the same pattern. All right. 116 00:11:18,427 --> 00:11:20,679 Am I glad you're here, sir. 117 00:11:20,762 --> 00:11:23,347 They say Detective Walenski's got the heebie-jeebies. 118 00:11:23,432 --> 00:11:25,684 Just take what they give me, Husselbeck. 119 00:11:28,145 --> 00:11:29,896 OK, thanks. 120 00:11:48,916 --> 00:11:50,959 Come on. I ain't got any Italian sausages. 121 00:11:51,043 --> 00:11:52,127 I'm running out of plates. 122 00:11:56,048 --> 00:11:57,841 Thanks a lot. 123 00:11:57,925 --> 00:11:59,301 Excuse me. 124 00:12:01,428 --> 00:12:03,930 Hello. Oh, it's you. 125 00:12:04,014 --> 00:12:05,682 You left your wallet here, buddy. 126 00:12:05,766 --> 00:12:07,911 Oh, when... when did I do that? When you was last here. 127 00:12:07,935 --> 00:12:11,021 When... When was that? When you left your wallet. 128 00:12:11,104 --> 00:12:12,855 You expect me to remember? 129 00:12:15,692 --> 00:12:18,528 Hello. Excuse me. 130 00:12:19,363 --> 00:12:21,782 No, no, seriously. 131 00:12:21,865 --> 00:12:23,533 Heh heh heh. 132 00:12:24,618 --> 00:12:26,077 Alleged? 133 00:12:38,298 --> 00:12:40,133 Where you headed, chief? Home. 134 00:12:40,217 --> 00:12:41,509 And where's home? 135 00:12:41,593 --> 00:12:44,304 Haven't you mugs got anything better to do, hm? 136 00:12:44,388 --> 00:12:46,598 Well, I'm just trying to do my job, May. 137 00:12:46,682 --> 00:12:48,785 There's a killer out there, in case you hadn't noticed. 138 00:12:48,809 --> 00:12:50,036 Maybe you should be out looking for him... 139 00:12:50,060 --> 00:12:51,436 instead of cooling your heels, huh? 140 00:12:53,814 --> 00:12:56,525 Aw, go on, get out of here. 141 00:13:04,866 --> 00:13:05,866 Come on. 142 00:13:09,538 --> 00:13:11,164 What's that make so far, Husselbeck? 143 00:13:11,248 --> 00:13:13,541 6 hookers in all? I believe so, sir. 144 00:13:13,625 --> 00:13:15,501 Give the man an "A" for effort. 145 00:13:20,882 --> 00:13:23,092 So, Husselbeck... 146 00:13:23,176 --> 00:13:26,512 what kind of killer do you think stops... 147 00:13:26,596 --> 00:13:29,640 to save a dying fish? 148 00:13:29,725 --> 00:13:30,725 You've got me, sir. 149 00:13:30,767 --> 00:13:32,852 Bumstead, what took you? 150 00:13:32,936 --> 00:13:36,064 This killer's been running circles around us, thanks to Walenski. 151 00:13:36,148 --> 00:13:39,234 With all due respect, chief inspector, I've known Eddie a long time. 152 00:13:39,318 --> 00:13:40,986 He's a good cop. 153 00:13:41,069 --> 00:13:43,196 Whatever kind of cop Walenski once was... 154 00:13:43,280 --> 00:13:45,240 he let drift a long time ago. 155 00:13:45,324 --> 00:13:47,034 Let me talk to Bumstead! 156 00:13:47,117 --> 00:13:49,911 - Come on! - Hold on! 157 00:13:49,995 --> 00:13:52,247 Frank, Frank! 158 00:13:52,331 --> 00:13:53,665 Whoa! 159 00:13:53,749 --> 00:13:56,042 - Get his arm! - They're watching us! 160 00:13:56,126 --> 00:13:58,503 On your feet. There's no way out! 161 00:13:59,880 --> 00:14:01,590 God, can't you see? 162 00:14:04,968 --> 00:14:06,260 Let me go, let me go! 163 00:14:06,345 --> 00:14:07,804 I'm not gonna hurt you. I'm not... 164 00:14:08,847 --> 00:14:11,099 What was that? Walenski. 165 00:14:19,483 --> 00:14:22,569 I'm being punished for my sins, right? 166 00:14:22,652 --> 00:14:24,904 What did I ever do to inherit this? 167 00:14:24,988 --> 00:14:26,030 Where do you begin? 168 00:14:26,990 --> 00:14:31,160 Well, everything Detective Walenski... committed to paper should be here, so... 169 00:14:31,244 --> 00:14:34,747 The only thing that should be committed is Walenski. 170 00:14:36,375 --> 00:14:38,710 Nothing like a little healthy paranoia. 171 00:14:41,797 --> 00:14:43,924 Inspector Bumstead. 172 00:14:44,800 --> 00:14:47,511 I came here to file a missing persons report for my husband. 173 00:14:47,594 --> 00:14:50,179 Take it to the front desk. 174 00:14:50,263 --> 00:14:52,098 They told me to come see you. 175 00:14:53,850 --> 00:14:56,143 His name's John Murdoch. 176 00:14:58,271 --> 00:15:01,983 Do these names mean anything to you? 177 00:15:02,067 --> 00:15:04,903 No. Who are these women? 178 00:15:04,986 --> 00:15:06,570 Why are you looking for my husband? 179 00:15:06,655 --> 00:15:09,115 Are you going to accuse him of something? 180 00:15:09,199 --> 00:15:11,451 Maybe. Maybe murder. 181 00:15:11,535 --> 00:15:12,536 Whose murder? 182 00:15:13,954 --> 00:15:14,996 Which one? 183 00:15:15,080 --> 00:15:18,541 All of them. 184 00:15:18,625 --> 00:15:20,793 Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry, I'm sorry. 185 00:15:20,877 --> 00:15:23,087 I didn't mean to alarm you. I'm so sorry that I came. 186 00:15:23,171 --> 00:15:24,505 Just both made a mistake. 187 00:15:24,589 --> 00:15:28,509 Mrs. Murdoch, if you... Please, if you'll just give me half a second to explain... 188 00:15:37,853 --> 00:15:40,105 Have we met before? 189 00:15:40,188 --> 00:15:42,106 If we did... 190 00:15:42,190 --> 00:15:43,774 I hope you're still breathing. 191 00:15:43,859 --> 00:15:45,485 What's your name, honey? 192 00:15:47,154 --> 00:15:48,488 John. 193 00:15:48,572 --> 00:15:51,032 Well, that's an appropriate name. 194 00:15:51,908 --> 00:15:52,909 Yeah. 195 00:15:59,082 --> 00:16:00,249 I was just thinking. 196 00:16:04,463 --> 00:16:06,047 What you do... 197 00:16:07,257 --> 00:16:10,510 seems kind of dangerous... 198 00:16:10,594 --> 00:16:12,554 right now. 199 00:16:12,637 --> 00:16:14,347 I mean, how do you know I'm not the killer? 200 00:16:14,431 --> 00:16:17,600 You don't seem like the killer type. Why? 201 00:16:18,810 --> 00:16:20,450 You feeling any urges I should know about? 202 00:16:21,396 --> 00:16:22,397 Hm. 203 00:16:32,741 --> 00:16:34,617 Aw, shoot. 204 00:16:55,388 --> 00:16:56,680 Oh! 205 00:17:21,748 --> 00:17:25,460 So it seems you've discovered your unpleasant nature. 206 00:17:25,544 --> 00:17:26,545 Who are you? 207 00:17:26,628 --> 00:17:30,256 We might ask the same question, yes? 208 00:17:30,340 --> 00:17:32,925 Sleep now. 209 00:17:54,114 --> 00:17:56,616 Aah! 210 00:17:58,201 --> 00:17:59,285 He can tune. 211 00:18:19,055 --> 00:18:20,765 Uh! 212 00:18:52,505 --> 00:18:55,633 What is to be done? This man is dangerous. 213 00:18:55,717 --> 00:18:59,053 It is said he is able to tune. Impossible. 214 00:18:59,137 --> 00:19:01,889 We have seen it with our own eyes. 215 00:19:01,973 --> 00:19:04,350 On occasion the imprinting does not take. 216 00:19:04,434 --> 00:19:07,520 They behave erratically when they awaken. 217 00:19:07,604 --> 00:19:11,024 We find them wandering like lost children. 218 00:19:11,107 --> 00:19:13,234 But this one was different, yes? 219 00:19:13,318 --> 00:19:14,986 What has the doctor to say about this? 220 00:19:15,070 --> 00:19:16,988 He has failed to report in. 221 00:19:17,072 --> 00:19:20,158 And Mr. Quick? No more Mr. Quick. 222 00:19:20,241 --> 00:19:23,327 Mr. Quick, dead, yes. 223 00:19:26,623 --> 00:19:28,833 Poor, poor Mr. Quick. 224 00:19:28,917 --> 00:19:31,878 Mr. Book, does he know? 225 00:19:33,129 --> 00:19:34,922 Should we not know, Mr. Hand? 226 00:19:35,006 --> 00:19:38,801 We had hoped to learn more before sharing with you. 227 00:19:38,885 --> 00:19:41,762 We can know nothing until we possess him. 228 00:19:41,846 --> 00:19:44,807 We must have this man. 229 00:19:50,105 --> 00:19:51,231 My brand, I hope. 230 00:19:52,399 --> 00:19:53,441 John. 231 00:20:02,867 --> 00:20:05,744 I've been so worried about you. 232 00:20:09,124 --> 00:20:11,167 Are you punishing me? 233 00:20:11,251 --> 00:20:13,795 You know, if disappearing is your way of punishing me... 234 00:20:13,878 --> 00:20:14,920 I don't appreciate it. 235 00:20:15,004 --> 00:20:17,089 I don't know what you're talking about. 236 00:20:19,926 --> 00:20:22,386 I found these keys in my pocket... 237 00:20:22,470 --> 00:20:25,097 so I assume I live here. 238 00:20:25,181 --> 00:20:26,932 You supposed to be my wife? 239 00:20:27,016 --> 00:20:28,976 Supposed to be? 240 00:20:29,060 --> 00:20:31,145 John. 241 00:20:31,604 --> 00:20:33,314 You really... 242 00:20:33,398 --> 00:20:35,775 don't know who I am, do you? 243 00:20:36,693 --> 00:20:39,362 Your doctor called me. He was worried that this might happen. 244 00:20:39,446 --> 00:20:40,905 My doctor? 245 00:20:40,989 --> 00:20:43,491 Yeah. He, uh... 246 00:20:43,575 --> 00:20:45,535 he gave me his card. 247 00:20:45,618 --> 00:20:48,162 He's desperate to find you. 248 00:20:49,247 --> 00:20:51,999 Schreber. 249 00:20:55,044 --> 00:20:57,087 I feel like I'm living out someone else's nightmare. 250 00:20:57,172 --> 00:21:00,592 What happened to me? Why was I seeing a doctor? 251 00:21:00,675 --> 00:21:02,885 I had an affair. 252 00:21:03,887 --> 00:21:06,389 You were angry at me. 253 00:21:08,057 --> 00:21:09,683 Closing time. 254 00:21:09,768 --> 00:21:12,812 The pool is now closed. 255 00:21:19,110 --> 00:21:21,695 Dr. Schreber. 256 00:21:21,780 --> 00:21:23,406 How most unfortunate it is... 257 00:21:23,490 --> 00:21:27,327 that we were forced to seek you out here. 258 00:21:27,410 --> 00:21:31,910 You know how uncomfortable we find all this moisture. 259 00:21:32,665 --> 00:21:35,709 I'm sorry. I... Failed to report in, yes. 260 00:21:35,794 --> 00:21:38,379 I was frightened. I... I have a weak heart, you know. 261 00:21:38,463 --> 00:21:42,758 Your weakness is not, we think, an affair of the heart. 262 00:21:42,842 --> 00:21:44,969 We found this in his hotel room. 263 00:21:45,053 --> 00:21:48,931 Must we reproduce Mr. Murdoch's memories again? 264 00:21:49,015 --> 00:21:50,683 I tried to imprint him, but he woke up. 265 00:21:50,767 --> 00:21:53,162 He knocked the syringe right out of my hand. I tried to stop him. 266 00:21:53,186 --> 00:21:55,688 He has no memories, then? Only fragments. 267 00:21:55,772 --> 00:21:57,732 The procedure, it was interrupted. 268 00:21:57,816 --> 00:22:01,569 I... I guess it's only a matter of rounding him up. 269 00:22:01,653 --> 00:22:03,196 You have had strays before, right? 270 00:22:03,279 --> 00:22:05,155 This is no stray, Doctor. 271 00:22:05,240 --> 00:22:06,866 This one can tune. 272 00:22:06,950 --> 00:22:09,994 But that's impossible. I thought only you had that ability. 273 00:22:10,078 --> 00:22:12,205 You will process another template... 274 00:22:12,288 --> 00:22:14,415 of the subject's memories, yes? 275 00:22:14,499 --> 00:22:17,043 Of course. I'll imprint him again. 276 00:22:17,126 --> 00:22:20,838 No. We require them for a quite different purpose. 277 00:22:20,922 --> 00:22:23,674 It's almost midnight, Dr. Schreber. 278 00:22:23,758 --> 00:22:25,509 We'll talk again after tonight's tuning... 279 00:22:25,593 --> 00:22:28,512 but no more delays, yes? 280 00:22:28,596 --> 00:22:33,096 No more inconsistencies in your behavior. 281 00:22:34,894 --> 00:22:36,896 The police are looking for you. 282 00:22:36,980 --> 00:22:39,232 I know. I saw the papers. 283 00:22:39,315 --> 00:22:41,900 "Killer Stalks City Streetwalkers." 284 00:22:45,321 --> 00:22:48,991 I was with one of those women... 285 00:22:49,075 --> 00:22:50,826 before I came here tonight. 286 00:22:50,910 --> 00:22:53,037 I don't understand. 287 00:22:53,121 --> 00:22:55,456 I... I met her outside an Automat. 288 00:22:55,540 --> 00:22:58,751 I guess I wanted to test myself. 289 00:22:58,835 --> 00:23:02,713 I wanted to know if I had it in me to do those things. 290 00:23:02,797 --> 00:23:05,758 Maybe I have lost my mind, but whoever I am, I'm still me... 291 00:23:05,842 --> 00:23:07,260 and I'm not a killer. 292 00:23:12,932 --> 00:23:16,393 I believe you. 293 00:23:16,477 --> 00:23:18,687 You do? 294 00:23:22,191 --> 00:23:24,234 - What? - The car outside... 295 00:23:24,319 --> 00:23:25,611 the one you arrived in. 296 00:23:25,695 --> 00:23:27,947 It's a cop. He dropped me off here. 297 00:23:30,199 --> 00:23:32,784 I didn't know he was still here. 298 00:23:32,869 --> 00:23:33,870 John. 299 00:23:35,204 --> 00:23:37,915 Hold it right there, mister! 300 00:23:39,459 --> 00:23:41,252 Wait. You have the wrong man. 301 00:23:41,336 --> 00:23:44,047 Stand aside, will you, please? I didn't kill anyone. 302 00:23:44,130 --> 00:23:48,092 Right now what you are is a suspect. Turn yourself in. 303 00:23:48,176 --> 00:23:49,737 I'll listen to whatever you have to say. 304 00:23:49,761 --> 00:23:52,680 You're not gonna believe what I have to say. 305 00:23:52,764 --> 00:23:53,848 Try me. 306 00:23:53,932 --> 00:23:55,975 There's someone after me. 307 00:23:56,059 --> 00:23:59,145 There's this group of men. They want me dead. 308 00:23:59,228 --> 00:24:02,564 And I don't even know if... I... They're not even... 309 00:24:02,649 --> 00:24:04,817 Yeah, who's gonna listen to a madman? 310 00:24:04,901 --> 00:24:06,819 Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch. 311 00:24:06,903 --> 00:24:07,945 Run! 312 00:24:11,741 --> 00:24:14,452 No one ever listens to me. 313 00:24:20,083 --> 00:24:21,125 Murdoch, stop! 314 00:24:26,255 --> 00:24:27,589 Murdoch! 315 00:25:04,127 --> 00:25:05,211 How much further? 316 00:25:05,294 --> 00:25:06,334 We're almost there, buddy. 317 00:25:09,090 --> 00:25:12,218 Hey, you happen to know the way to Shell Beach? 318 00:25:12,301 --> 00:25:13,385 You're kidding. 319 00:25:13,469 --> 00:25:15,220 Me and the missus spent our honeymoon there. 320 00:25:15,304 --> 00:25:18,056 All you gotta do is take Main Street West to... 321 00:25:20,893 --> 00:25:22,561 Or is it the cross... 322 00:25:22,645 --> 00:25:26,231 You know, that's funny. I... I'm gonna call the station. 637 00:53:45,054 --> 00:53:46,346 Stay back, please. 638 00:53:58,693 --> 00:53:59,819 It's beautiful. 639 00:54:02,280 --> 00:54:05,199 It was a gift from my mother. 640 00:54:05,283 --> 00:54:08,119 She died recently. 641 00:54:08,202 --> 00:54:10,537 I keep it with me to remind me of her. 642 00:54:12,540 --> 00:54:13,874 I'm sorry. 643 00:54:17,336 --> 00:54:19,463 It's a funny thing, though. 644 00:54:19,547 --> 00:54:21,882 I can't remember when she gave it to me. 645 00:54:24,469 --> 00:54:27,430 How do you think I could forget a thing like that? 646 00:54:27,513 --> 00:54:30,432 What's happening, inspector? 647 00:54:30,516 --> 00:54:33,227 I'm not sure I know anymore. 648 00:54:36,689 --> 00:54:39,274 I left your old room like it was. 649 00:54:39,358 --> 00:54:41,443 You can sleep here tonight, huh? 650 00:54:41,527 --> 00:54:45,531 Glad to have you back, Johnny, even if it is for just a night. 651 00:54:45,615 --> 00:54:47,658 Karl. Huh? 652 00:54:47,742 --> 00:54:48,909 Is that the right time? 653 00:54:48,993 --> 00:54:52,830 Why, sure. That clock's kept perfect time since I bought it. 654 00:54:52,914 --> 00:54:54,749 AM. Or PM? 655 00:54:55,875 --> 00:54:57,293 What do you think, Johnny? 656 00:54:57,376 --> 00:54:59,336 I don't understand. How can it be night already? 657 00:54:59,420 --> 00:55:01,060 What happened to the day? How'd I miss it? 658 00:55:01,088 --> 00:55:03,965 You're tired. Anything's possible. 659 00:55:04,050 --> 00:55:08,550 Look, uh, get some sleep. He's not himself. 665 00:56:07,905 --> 00:56:09,865 Keep him there, and I'll be right over. 666 00:56:09,949 --> 00:56:12,242 I'll try. Thanks, Karl. Bye. 667 00:56:14,745 --> 00:56:15,746 Johnny... 668 00:56:15,830 --> 00:56:19,250 I can't promise anything, Mrs. Murdoch. Uncle Karl. 671 00:56:33,139 --> 00:56:35,432 Johnny, if you're in some kind of trouble... 672 00:56:35,516 --> 00:56:38,143 well, maybe we could do something. 673 00:56:38,227 --> 00:56:40,729 Haven't seen you in so long. 674 00:56:40,813 --> 00:56:42,648 Yes. 675 00:57:55,346 --> 00:57:56,930 Mr. Murdoch... 676 00:57:57,014 --> 00:58:00,767 you've been the cause of much distress. 677 00:58:04,814 --> 00:58:05,814 Start talking. 678 00:58:05,856 --> 00:58:08,525 There's no need for this. There's no escape. 679 00:58:08,609 --> 00:58:10,652 The city's ours. We made it. 680 00:58:10,736 --> 00:58:12,195 What are you talking about? 681 00:58:12,279 --> 00:58:15,407 We fashioned this city on stolen memories... 682 00:58:15,491 --> 00:58:19,411 different eras, different pasts, all rolled into one. 683 00:58:19,495 --> 00:58:23,373 Each night, we revise it, refine it, in order to learn. 684 00:58:23,457 --> 00:58:26,293 Learn what? About you, Mr. Murdoch... 685 00:58:26,377 --> 00:58:30,422 you and your fellow inhabitants, what makes you human. 686 00:58:30,506 --> 00:58:31,965 Why?! 687 00:58:32,049 --> 00:58:34,384 We need to be like you. 688 00:58:34,468 --> 00:58:37,304 I understand you now, Mr. Murdoch. 689 00:58:37,388 --> 00:58:40,933 I remember that which you do not, what you've been missing. 690 00:58:41,017 --> 00:58:42,643 The ocean, yes... 691 00:58:43,686 --> 00:58:46,230 running along the waves as a child... 692 00:58:46,313 --> 00:58:48,732 meeting Emma at the river... 693 00:58:48,816 --> 00:58:51,902 that first kiss that followed. 694 00:58:51,986 --> 00:58:54,905 What are you? You've seen what we are. 695 00:58:54,989 --> 00:58:57,825 We use your dead as vessels. 696 00:58:57,908 --> 00:59:00,201 Oh! Ah! Ah! 697 00:59:01,495 --> 00:59:03,121 Aah! 698 00:59:41,368 --> 00:59:43,078 Ah! Ah! 699 00:59:43,162 --> 00:59:45,372 Ah! Aah! Aaah! 700 00:59:45,456 --> 00:59:46,957 Aah! Aah! 701 01:00:04,892 --> 01:00:06,226 Aah! 702 01:00:19,031 --> 01:00:20,741 Uhh! Uhh! 703 01:00:55,067 --> 01:00:56,193 Whaa! Ooph. 704 01:01:07,538 --> 01:01:08,539 Get in! 705 01:01:24,013 --> 01:01:26,473 What about her? Ring any bells? 706 01:01:26,557 --> 01:01:28,976 She was alive when I left her. What about this? 707 01:01:29,059 --> 01:01:31,061 This is nothing. I... th... this is... 708 01:01:31,145 --> 01:01:33,397 It must mean something, all those pictures. 709 01:01:33,480 --> 01:01:34,647 What pictures? 710 01:01:35,649 --> 01:01:38,526 I don't understand this. Stop playing games with me, Murdoch! 711 01:01:38,611 --> 01:01:41,030 Stop telling me lies! I am not telling you lies! 712 01:01:41,113 --> 01:01:43,448 Help me out here. Make me understand. 713 01:01:43,532 --> 01:01:45,575 I have this jigsaw puzzle in front of my face... 714 01:01:45,659 --> 01:01:47,470 and every time I try to rearrange the pieces... 715 01:01:47,494 --> 01:01:49,764 it still doesn't make any sense. You... you think it makes sense to me? 716 01:01:49,788 --> 01:01:52,165 I'm as much in the dark here as you are. 717 01:01:52,249 --> 01:01:54,042 You let me ask you a question? 718 01:01:54,126 --> 01:01:55,562 You heard of a place called Shell Beach? 719 01:01:55,586 --> 01:01:57,379 Sure. You know how to get there? 720 01:01:57,463 --> 01:01:59,506 Yeah. You tell me? 721 01:01:59,590 --> 01:02:02,426 All right. You just, uh... 722 01:02:02,509 --> 01:02:04,511 You go to the... 723 01:02:04,595 --> 01:02:07,806 - Where? Where do you go? - Just give me a second, will ya? 724 01:02:09,058 --> 01:02:10,684 You can't remember, can you? 725 01:02:12,019 --> 01:02:14,563 You think that's kind of odd? Hmm? 726 01:02:15,522 --> 01:02:17,899 Wait. I got a better one for you. 727 01:02:17,983 --> 01:02:19,234 When was the last time... 728 01:02:19,318 --> 01:02:22,112 you remember doing something during the day? 729 01:02:22,196 --> 01:02:25,490 What do you mean? I just mean... during the day. 730 01:02:25,574 --> 01:02:26,992 Ha. Daylight. 731 01:02:27,076 --> 01:02:29,244 Ha. When was the last time you remember seeing it? 732 01:02:29,328 --> 01:02:31,455 And I'm not talking about some distant... 733 01:02:31,538 --> 01:02:33,039 half-forgotten childhood memory. 734 01:02:33,123 --> 01:02:36,209 I mean like yesterday? Last week? When? 735 01:02:36,293 --> 01:02:38,712 Can you come up with a single memory? 736 01:02:40,214 --> 01:02:41,465 You can't, can you? 737 01:02:41,548 --> 01:02:44,717 You know something? I don't think the sun even... 738 01:02:44,802 --> 01:02:47,471 exists... in this place. 739 01:02:47,554 --> 01:02:50,265 'Cause I've been up for hours and hours and hours... 740 01:02:50,349 --> 01:02:52,476 and the night never ends here. 741 01:02:52,559 --> 01:02:55,144 That is crazy. You're damn right this is crazy. 742 01:02:55,229 --> 01:02:57,606 Listen to me, Bumstead. It's not just me. 743 01:02:57,690 --> 01:02:59,650 It's all of us. 744 01:02:59,733 --> 01:03:01,276 They're doing something to all of us. 745 01:03:01,360 --> 01:03:04,071 Shut up, you... I... I've heard enough. Please listen. 746 01:03:04,154 --> 01:03:05,905 Shut up! Shut up! Listen to me! 747 01:03:16,083 --> 01:03:19,377 There has to be an explanation for this somewhere. 748 01:03:26,468 --> 01:03:27,760 Explain this. 749 01:03:48,532 --> 01:03:50,867 John, I'm so sorry. 750 01:03:51,994 --> 01:03:54,848 I never meant to hurt you, John, and I did it, and I don't know why I did. 751 01:03:54,872 --> 01:03:56,957 I wish I could take it all back. 752 01:03:57,041 --> 01:03:59,543 No. Emma, you didn't do it. 753 01:03:59,626 --> 01:04:02,337 This... affair of yours, whatever it is... 754 01:04:02,421 --> 01:04:04,065 that you think you're supposed to have done... 755 01:04:04,089 --> 01:04:05,942 You didn't do it. I don't believe it ever happened. 756 01:04:05,966 --> 01:04:09,719 What do you mean? I know this is gonna sound crazy... 757 01:04:09,803 --> 01:04:12,722 but what if we never knew each other before now? 758 01:04:12,806 --> 01:04:16,893 What if the first time we ever met was last night... 759 01:04:16,977 --> 01:04:19,062 in your ap... in our apartment... 760 01:04:19,146 --> 01:04:21,982 and everything you remember... 761 01:04:22,066 --> 01:04:23,877 and everything that I'm supposed to remember... 762 01:04:23,901 --> 01:04:24,902 never really happened? 763 01:04:24,985 --> 01:04:27,570 Someone just wants us to think it did. 764 01:04:28,572 --> 01:04:30,907 But how can that be true? 765 01:04:30,991 --> 01:04:34,869 I so vividly remember meeting you. 766 01:04:34,953 --> 01:04:38,915 I remember falling in love with you. 767 01:04:38,999 --> 01:04:41,084 I remember losing you. 768 01:04:41,168 --> 01:04:42,752 Time's up. 769 01:04:43,462 --> 01:04:45,046 No, wait, wait. 770 01:04:45,130 --> 01:04:48,383 Please, just... Just one more minute. 771 01:04:54,848 --> 01:04:57,016 I love you, John. 772 01:04:59,561 --> 01:05:02,522 You can't fake something like that. 773 01:05:03,524 --> 01:05:04,858 No, you can't. 774 01:05:33,929 --> 01:05:36,932 Inspector? Sir? 775 01:05:38,308 --> 01:05:40,893 Detective Walenski killed himself last night. 776 01:05:40,978 --> 01:05:44,731 I, um, kind of thought you should know. 777 01:05:47,317 --> 01:05:51,237 Oh, and the chief wanted to see you. 778 01:05:51,321 --> 01:05:52,322 Sir... 779 01:05:58,412 --> 01:06:00,455 I knew you'd track the killer down, sir. 780 01:06:11,008 --> 01:06:14,177 Um... Sir... 781 01:06:15,762 --> 01:06:17,138 shoelace. 782 01:06:30,319 --> 01:06:33,864 How can we help you, sir? You can sleep. 783 01:06:35,991 --> 01:06:38,576 Gentlemen... Sleep. Sleep. 784 01:06:42,289 --> 01:06:43,456 Evening, sir. 785 01:06:52,341 --> 01:06:53,550 Bumstead. 786 01:06:56,386 --> 01:07:00,264 I wanted to be the first to congratulate you about the case. 787 01:07:02,643 --> 01:07:05,395 Take us to Murdoch. 788 01:07:05,479 --> 01:07:06,480 Sleep. 789 01:07:34,174 --> 01:07:36,718 Dr. Schreber. Ah. 790 01:07:36,802 --> 01:07:38,470 I knew you'd come eventually. 791 01:07:38,554 --> 01:07:41,265 Don't you think it's about time you started giving me some answers? 792 01:07:41,348 --> 01:07:43,433 Yes. Yes, of course. 793 01:07:43,517 --> 01:07:45,310 Won't you please sit down? 794 01:07:48,397 --> 01:07:50,440 I... I come here quite often. 795 01:07:50,524 --> 01:07:52,901 It's one of the few places I'm allowed a moment's peace. 796 01:07:52,985 --> 01:07:57,447 You... you see, they have an aversion to... to water. 797 01:07:57,531 --> 01:07:59,366 One could almost call it a phobia. 798 01:07:59,449 --> 01:08:01,242 Ha ha ha ha. Who are they? 799 01:08:01,326 --> 01:08:04,203 What do they want from me? Right. 800 01:08:04,288 --> 01:08:06,290 Well, for now, let's just say... 801 01:08:06,373 --> 01:08:09,042 that you are the subject of their experiment. 802 01:08:09,126 --> 01:08:11,253 W... w... we all are. 803 01:08:11,336 --> 01:08:13,671 I'm sorry about this. I truly am. 804 01:08:13,755 --> 01:08:16,382 But we do not have much time and I cannot afford the luxury... 805 01:08:16,466 --> 01:08:17,967 of doing this the right way. 806 01:08:18,051 --> 01:08:20,636 Everything you need to know, all the answers... 807 01:08:20,721 --> 01:08:21,805 are in this syringe. 808 01:08:21,888 --> 01:08:23,139 I need you to inject yourself. 809 01:08:23,223 --> 01:08:25,558 It's the only way to make you understand. 810 01:08:25,642 --> 01:08:28,204 - Y... you're kidding me, right? - We're running out of time, John. 811 01:08:28,228 --> 01:08:30,480 You have to do this now. 812 01:08:30,564 --> 01:08:31,982 Give me the gun, Doctor. 813 01:08:32,065 --> 01:08:34,484 Inspector, he is more disturbed than we thought. 814 01:08:34,568 --> 01:08:37,153 I may not be the judge of personality that you are, Doctor... 815 01:08:37,237 --> 01:08:40,198 but you're the one who looks disturbed to me. 816 01:08:40,282 --> 01:08:42,909 You do not know what you are doing. 817 01:08:44,119 --> 01:08:48,081 What, exactly, is in this... Doctor? 818 01:08:49,458 --> 01:08:51,668 All the answers you've been looking for, John... 819 01:08:51,752 --> 01:08:54,296 I swear to you. Uh-huh. 820 01:08:54,379 --> 01:08:58,879 Guess I'll just have to hold on to it for safekeeping... 821 01:08:59,468 --> 01:09:00,635 if you don't mind. 822 01:09:00,719 --> 01:09:02,095 Let's go, Doctor. 823 01:09:03,430 --> 01:09:06,683 Go? Where are we going? 824 01:09:06,767 --> 01:09:09,686 Shell Beach. 825 01:09:09,770 --> 01:09:12,147 That's where you want to go, isn't it? 826 01:09:12,230 --> 01:09:13,773 The ocean. 827 01:09:22,157 --> 01:09:25,535 You won't find anything there, I promise you! I've been there, and... 828 01:09:25,619 --> 01:09:28,099 If you've been there, you can show us the way, then, can't you? 829 01:09:28,163 --> 01:09:29,831 I won't. I refuse. 830 01:09:29,915 --> 01:09:31,499 You... You can't make me go there! 831 01:09:31,583 --> 01:09:34,127 Don't you understand? They'll be waiting for us. 832 01:09:43,220 --> 01:09:45,055 I don't understand. 833 01:09:45,138 --> 01:09:46,764 Used to be a bridge here. 834 01:09:53,480 --> 01:09:56,399 Try that again, your friends are gonna be fishing you out of the canal. 835 01:09:56,483 --> 01:09:58,044 Just don't hurt me. I'll tell you everything. 836 01:09:58,068 --> 01:09:59,986 It doesn't matter anymore anyway. 837 01:10:06,910 --> 01:10:09,162 What? 838 01:10:10,789 --> 01:10:13,082 Who are you people? 839 01:10:13,166 --> 01:10:16,002 We must go to the end of the canal. 840 01:10:17,254 --> 01:10:21,754 We will give you some more pretty things soon... Anna. 841 01:10:21,842 --> 01:10:23,552 I'm not Anna. 842 01:10:25,303 --> 01:10:27,305 You will be soon, yes. 843 01:10:31,309 --> 01:10:34,186 I have another use for her first. 844 01:10:43,280 --> 01:10:46,283 I call them... the strangers. 845 01:10:46,366 --> 01:10:49,452 They abducted us and brought us here. 846 01:10:49,536 --> 01:10:53,957 This city, everyone in it, is their experiment. 847 01:10:54,040 --> 01:10:57,209 They mix and match our memories as they see fit... 848 01:10:57,294 --> 01:11:00,297 trying to divine what makes us unique. 849 01:11:00,380 --> 01:11:03,091 One day, a man might be an inspector. 850 01:11:03,175 --> 01:11:06,094 The next, someone entirely different. 851 01:11:06,178 --> 01:11:09,431 When they want to study a murderer, for instance... 852 01:11:09,514 --> 01:11:14,014 they simply imprint one of their citizens with a new personality... 853 01:11:14,394 --> 01:11:18,439 arrange a family for him... friends, an entire history... 854 01:11:18,523 --> 01:11:20,316 even a lost wallet. 855 01:11:20,400 --> 01:11:22,568 Then they observe the results. 856 01:11:24,029 --> 01:11:26,448 Willa man, given the history of a killer... 857 01:11:26,531 --> 01:11:28,074 continue in that vein? 858 01:11:28,158 --> 01:11:29,826 Or are we, in fact... 859 01:11:29,910 --> 01:11:32,162 more than the mere sum of our memories? 860 01:11:32,245 --> 01:11:34,538 This business of you being a killer... 861 01:11:34,623 --> 01:11:37,167 was an unhappy coincidence. 862 01:11:37,250 --> 01:11:40,086 You have had dozens of lives before now. 863 01:11:40,170 --> 01:11:41,504 You just happened to wake up... 864 01:11:41,588 --> 01:11:44,173 while I was imprinting you... with this one. 865 01:11:44,257 --> 01:11:46,342 Why are they doing all this? 866 01:11:46,426 --> 01:11:49,762 It is our capacity for individuality... 867 01:11:49,846 --> 01:11:52,390 our souls, that makes us different from them. 868 01:11:52,474 --> 01:11:54,809 They think they can find the human soul... 869 01:11:54,893 --> 01:11:57,604 if they understand how our memories work. 870 01:11:57,687 --> 01:11:59,271 All they have are collective memories. 871 01:11:59,356 --> 01:12:02,150 They share one group mind. 872 01:12:02,234 --> 01:12:03,652 They're dying, you see? 873 01:12:03,735 --> 01:12:07,113 Their entire race is on the brink of extinction. 874 01:12:07,197 --> 01:12:08,990 They think we can save them. Ha. 875 01:12:09,074 --> 01:12:12,077 Where do I fit in? You are different, John. 876 01:12:12,160 --> 01:12:14,954 You resisted my attempt to imprint you. 877 01:12:19,626 --> 01:12:22,545 Somehow you have developed their ability to tune. 878 01:12:22,629 --> 01:12:25,840 That is how they change things. That is how they built this city. 879 01:12:25,924 --> 01:12:30,011 They have machines buried deep beneath the surface that allow them... 880 01:12:30,095 --> 01:12:33,515 to focus their telepathic energies. 881 01:12:33,598 --> 01:12:36,058 They control everything here, even the sun. 882 01:12:36,142 --> 01:12:39,603 That's why it's always dark. They can't stand the light. 883 01:12:39,688 --> 01:12:40,814 So why do they need you? 884 01:12:40,897 --> 01:12:43,065 When they first brought us here... 885 01:12:43,149 --> 01:12:44,817 they extracted what was in us. 886 01:12:44,901 --> 01:12:46,903 So they could store the information... 887 01:12:46,987 --> 01:12:49,072 remix it like so much paint... 888 01:12:49,155 --> 01:12:51,699 and give us back new memories of their choosing. 889 01:12:51,783 --> 01:12:55,411 But they still needed an artist to help them. 890 01:12:57,205 --> 01:13:00,333 I understood the intricacies of the human mind... 891 01:13:00,417 --> 01:13:02,919 better than they ever could... 892 01:13:03,003 --> 01:13:05,714 so they allowed me... to keep my skills as a scientist... 893 01:13:05,797 --> 01:13:07,131 because they needed them. 894 01:13:07,215 --> 01:13:09,675 But they made me delete everything else. 895 01:13:18,018 --> 01:13:20,895 Can you imagine what it is like being forced... 896 01:13:20,979 --> 01:13:22,605 to erase your own past? 897 01:13:22,689 --> 01:13:24,607 What about my past? 898 01:13:24,691 --> 01:13:26,901 What about my childhood? 899 01:13:26,985 --> 01:13:29,612 Shell Beach, Uncle Karl. 900 01:13:29,696 --> 01:13:32,573 What about this? 901 01:13:32,657 --> 01:13:34,450 This was blank when I found it! 902 01:13:34,534 --> 01:13:36,452 You still don't understand, John. 903 01:13:36,536 --> 01:13:39,705 You were never a boy, not in this place. 904 01:13:39,789 --> 01:13:42,666 Your entire history is an illusion, a fabrication... 905 01:13:42,751 --> 01:13:44,461 as it is with all of us. 906 01:13:44,544 --> 01:13:47,088 You made those drawings happen with your gift. 907 01:13:47,172 --> 01:13:50,717 You say they brought us here. 908 01:13:50,800 --> 01:13:51,884 From where? 909 01:13:55,805 --> 01:13:57,807 I'm sorry. 910 01:13:57,891 --> 01:13:59,642 I don't remember. 911 01:13:59,726 --> 01:14:01,477 None of us remember that. 912 01:14:01,561 --> 01:14:03,771 What we once were... 913 01:14:03,855 --> 01:14:06,190 what we might have been... 914 01:14:06,274 --> 01:14:07,692 somewhere else. 915 01:14:25,168 --> 01:14:27,086 I've taken you this far. 916 01:14:27,170 --> 01:14:29,255 You don't need me anymore. 917 01:14:29,339 --> 01:14:31,174 Let's go. 918 01:14:49,567 --> 01:14:51,110 John. 919 01:15:15,176 --> 01:15:18,012 There is no ocean, John. 920 01:15:18,096 --> 01:15:22,183 There is nothing beyond the city. 921 01:15:22,267 --> 01:15:25,520 The only place home exists... 922 01:15:27,355 --> 01:15:29,440 is in your head. 923 01:15:37,741 --> 01:15:39,409 No! No! 924 01:15:39,492 --> 01:15:41,327 John, stop! 925 01:15:43,955 --> 01:15:45,081 No! 926 01:15:47,792 --> 01:15:48,793 Stop! 927 01:15:54,758 --> 01:15:56,134 Please! 928 01:15:56,801 --> 01:15:58,219 No! 929 01:16:00,972 --> 01:16:02,306 Aah! Uhh! 930 01:16:16,488 --> 01:16:18,656 And now you know the truth. 931 01:16:26,498 --> 01:16:27,999 Ahhh! 932 01:16:35,465 --> 01:16:36,799 Aah! 933 01:16:38,009 --> 01:16:40,302 No! 934 01:16:40,386 --> 01:16:41,762 Aah! 935 01:17:18,007 --> 01:17:20,843 You'll allow yourself to surrender, Mr. Murdoch... 936 01:17:20,927 --> 01:17:23,137 or it will result in this one's death, yes? 937 01:17:23,221 --> 01:17:26,933 What do I care? She's not my real wife! She's nothing to me! 938 01:17:27,016 --> 01:17:31,516 But you do still care, don't you, Mr. Murdoch? 939 01:17:31,813 --> 01:17:33,898 You see, I have become the monster... 940 01:17:33,982 --> 01:17:35,942 you were intended to be. 941 01:17:36,025 --> 01:17:37,651 Uhh! 942 01:17:37,735 --> 01:17:41,613 Shall I end her life now as you would have? 943 01:17:44,659 --> 01:17:46,869 Don't hurt her, please! 944 01:17:46,953 --> 01:17:51,453 Then surrender, Mr. Murdoch. 945 01:17:51,624 --> 01:17:53,208 Sleep. 946 01:17:55,128 --> 01:17:57,296 Now. 947 01:17:59,132 --> 01:18:00,800 John? 948 01:18:15,815 --> 01:18:17,024 Sleep. 949 01:18:26,159 --> 01:18:27,577 Kill him. 950 01:18:27,660 --> 01:18:29,244 Kill him! Kill him! 951 01:18:29,329 --> 01:18:31,998 Kill him! Kill him! Kill him! 952 01:18:32,081 --> 01:18:34,917 Kill him! Kill him! 953 01:18:35,001 --> 01:18:38,754 Kill him! Kill him! Kill him! 954 01:18:38,838 --> 01:18:41,340 He is powerful, yes. 955 01:18:41,424 --> 01:18:45,845 Dangerous. But he can also lead us to what we seek. 956 01:18:45,929 --> 01:18:49,265 What the doctor calls the soul. 957 01:18:49,349 --> 01:18:53,019 It is time for our experiment to move into a final phase. 958 01:18:53,102 --> 01:18:55,771 We no longer need the other subjects. 959 01:18:55,855 --> 01:18:59,441 The time for study is over. 960 01:18:59,525 --> 01:19:03,779 It is time to be one with John Murdoch. 961 01:19:10,453 --> 01:19:12,204 It is time, Doctor. 962 01:19:12,288 --> 01:19:13,831 Imprint. 963 01:19:16,626 --> 01:19:19,295 Shut it down! 964 01:19:19,379 --> 01:19:22,590 Shut it down forever! 965 01:19:36,396 --> 01:19:37,730 What are you doing? 966 01:19:38,731 --> 01:19:40,649 They want to imprint you... 967 01:19:40,733 --> 01:19:43,318 with their own collective memories. 968 01:19:44,654 --> 01:19:46,489 They want to make you one of them... 969 01:19:46,572 --> 01:19:48,782 so they can share your soul. 970 01:19:48,866 --> 01:19:51,243 But I've got other plans. 971 01:19:54,914 --> 01:19:57,166 Imprint, Doctor. No more disobedience. 972 01:19:57,250 --> 01:19:59,168 I'm sorry, John. 973 01:19:59,252 --> 01:20:02,171 The pain will only last a moment. 974 01:20:04,257 --> 01:20:05,258 No! 975 01:20:13,433 --> 01:20:15,685 Remember, John. 976 01:20:15,768 --> 01:20:18,187 You'll rise to greater heights than that, my boy. 977 01:20:18,271 --> 01:20:20,031 One day when you're older, you'll understand. 978 01:20:21,899 --> 01:20:23,025 Remember. 979 01:20:24,193 --> 01:20:27,029 That's it, John. Practice makes perfect. 980 01:20:27,113 --> 01:20:30,282 Now remember what I told you. Never talk to strangers. 981 01:20:30,366 --> 01:20:32,076 John, remember. 982 01:20:32,160 --> 01:20:35,037 You're probably wondering why I keep appearing in your memories. 983 01:20:35,121 --> 01:20:37,665 It is because I have inserted myself in them. 984 01:20:37,749 --> 01:20:39,792 All of these memories have been fabricated... 985 01:20:39,876 --> 01:20:41,544 to teach you about the strangers. 986 01:20:41,627 --> 01:20:44,671 Give you a lifetime of knowledge in a single syringe. 987 01:20:47,592 --> 01:20:49,885 You will survive, John. 988 01:20:49,969 --> 01:20:52,221 You will find strength within yourself... 989 01:20:52,305 --> 01:20:54,181 and you will prevail. 990 01:20:54,265 --> 01:20:56,392 Remember. 991 01:20:56,476 --> 01:20:58,478 Hi, Uncle Karl. Johnny! 992 01:21:01,439 --> 01:21:03,566 You're getting the hang of it, John. 993 01:21:03,649 --> 01:21:06,234 Maybe one day I'll be working for you. 994 01:21:06,319 --> 01:21:09,697 This is the machine the strangers use to amplify their thoughts. 995 01:21:09,781 --> 01:21:11,574 The machine that changes their world. 996 01:21:11,657 --> 01:21:13,200 You must take control of it. 997 01:21:13,284 --> 01:21:14,868 You must make the machine yours. 998 01:21:14,952 --> 01:21:17,037 I know you can beat them, John. 999 01:21:17,121 --> 01:21:18,789 But you must concentrate. 1000 01:21:21,709 --> 01:21:22,835 Something's wrong. 1001 01:21:27,465 --> 01:21:29,175 Aah! 1002 01:21:31,511 --> 01:21:34,180 There is no time for romance, John. 1003 01:21:34,263 --> 01:21:35,639 The world can be what you make it. 1004 01:21:36,641 --> 01:21:38,601 What have you done? 1005 01:21:38,684 --> 01:21:41,228 You have the power to make anything happen... 1006 01:21:41,312 --> 01:21:43,605 but you must act now! 1007 01:21:58,079 --> 01:21:59,538 Aahhh! 1008 01:22:49,714 --> 01:22:51,132 Aaah! 1009 01:23:02,560 --> 01:23:05,187 - Ahhhhhh! - Ahhhhhh! 1010 01:24:01,661 --> 01:24:04,664 Aah! 1011 01:24:10,294 --> 01:24:12,170 Aah! 1012 01:24:14,924 --> 01:24:16,050 Aaah! 1013 01:25:30,374 --> 01:25:32,167 Raah! 1014 01:25:34,045 --> 01:25:36,255 Aah! 1015 01:26:27,431 --> 01:26:29,057 I knew you could do it, John. 1016 01:26:29,141 --> 01:26:31,143 You have their power now. 1017 01:26:31,227 --> 01:26:32,811 You control their machines. 1018 01:26:32,895 --> 01:26:34,479 Where's Emma? 1019 01:26:34,563 --> 01:26:37,732 She is not Emma anymore, John. 1020 01:26:37,817 --> 01:26:39,485 She has been re-imprinted. 1021 01:26:39,568 --> 01:26:40,902 So give her back her memories. 1022 01:26:40,986 --> 01:26:43,405 I can't. The facility where the strangers... 1023 01:26:43,489 --> 01:26:46,408 stored the memories has been destroyed. 1024 01:26:46,492 --> 01:26:47,659 I'm sorry. 1025 01:26:48,703 --> 01:26:51,747 What are you going to do now, John? 1026 01:26:54,208 --> 01:26:57,294 Gonna fix things. 1027 01:26:57,378 --> 01:27:01,090 You told me I had the power, didn't you? 1028 01:27:01,173 --> 01:27:05,427 I can make these machines do anything I want. 1029 01:27:05,511 --> 01:27:08,514 Make this world anything I want it to be. 1030 01:27:08,597 --> 01:27:12,934 Just so long as I concentrate hard enough. 1031 01:28:36,519 --> 01:28:37,978 Where are you going? 1032 01:28:41,232 --> 01:28:42,733 Shell Beach. 1033 01:29:23,607 --> 01:29:24,899 What's the fare? Quarter. 1034 01:29:31,198 --> 01:29:32,198 Oh, please. 1035 01:29:32,241 --> 01:29:34,743 Oh, no... It's fine. 1036 01:29:34,827 --> 01:29:36,161 Thank you. OK. 1037 01:30:16,368 --> 01:30:18,328 John... 1038 01:30:21,832 --> 01:30:24,125 been waiting for you, yes? 1039 01:30:24,209 --> 01:30:25,793 What are you doing? 1040 01:30:25,878 --> 01:30:28,714 I'm just making a few little changes around here, is all. 1041 01:30:28,797 --> 01:30:30,965 Are we sure that's what we want? 1042 01:30:31,050 --> 01:30:33,802 I'm prepared to take my chances. 1043 01:30:33,886 --> 01:30:35,470 I'm dying, John. 1044 01:30:35,554 --> 01:30:39,599 Your imprint is not agreeable with my kind. 1045 01:30:39,683 --> 01:30:43,645 But I wanted to know what it was like... 1046 01:30:43,729 --> 01:30:45,063 how you feel. 1047 01:30:45,147 --> 01:30:47,816 You know how I was supposed to feel. 1048 01:30:47,900 --> 01:30:51,653 That person isn't me. It never was. 1049 01:30:51,737 --> 01:30:56,237 You wanted to know what it was about us that made us human. 1050 01:30:56,450 --> 01:31:00,950 Well, you're not going to find it... in here. 1051 01:31:01,580 --> 01:31:04,207 You went looking in the wrong place. 1052 01:31:53,298 --> 01:31:54,841 Aah! 1053 01:32:42,931 --> 01:32:44,849 It's so beautiful here. 1054 01:32:50,189 --> 01:32:51,648 80 bright. 1055 01:32:57,529 --> 01:33:00,323 Do you know if Shell Beach is around here? 1056 01:33:00,407 --> 01:33:03,034 I think that's it just over there. 1057 01:33:21,053 --> 01:33:23,221 I'm headed that way myself. 1058 01:33:24,723 --> 01:33:27,225 Would you like to join me? 1059 01:33:29,394 --> 01:33:30,436 Sure. 1060 01:33:35,776 --> 01:33:38,320 I'm Anna, by the way. 1061 01:33:38,403 --> 01:33:40,780 What's your name? John. 1062 01:33:43,200 --> 01:33:44,618 John Murdoch. 1063 01:38:33,115 --> 01:38:37,119 ♪ When marimba rhythms start to play ♪ 1064 01:38:37,202 --> 01:38:39,412 ♪ Dance with me ♪ 1065 01:38:39,496 --> 01:38:42,290 ♪ Make me sway ♪ 1066 01:38:42,374 --> 01:38:46,461 ♪ Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore ♪ 1067 01:38:46,545 --> 01:38:48,797 ♪ Hold me close ♪ 1068 01:38:48,880 --> 01:38:51,799 ♪ Sway me more ♪ 1069 01:38:51,883 --> 01:38:55,970 I Like a flower bending in the breeze ♪ 1070 01:38:56,054 --> 01:38:58,306 ♪ Bend with me ♪ 1071 01:38:58,390 --> 01:39:01,184 ♪ Sway with ease ♪ 1072 01:39:01,268 --> 01:39:05,313 ♪ When we dance you have a way with me ♪ 1073 01:39:05,397 --> 01:39:07,690 ♪ Stay with me ♪ 1074 01:39:07,774 --> 01:39:10,276 ♪ Sway with me ♪ 1075 01:39:10,360 --> 01:39:14,860 ♪ Other dancers may be on the floor ♪ 1076 01:39:15,157 --> 01:39:19,657 ♪ But my eyes will see only you ♪ 1077 01:39:19,911 --> 01:39:24,411 ♪ Only you have that magic technique ♪ 1078 01:39:25,750 --> 01:39:29,503 ♪ When we sway I go weak ♪ 1079 01:39:29,588 --> 01:39:33,341 ♪ I can hear the sound of violins ♪ 1080 01:39:33,425 --> 01:39:37,925 ♪ Long before it begins ♪ 1081 01:39:38,847 --> 01:39:42,725 ♪ Make me thrill as only you know how ♪ 1082 01:39:42,809 --> 01:39:47,309 ♪ Sway me smooth, sway me now ♪ 1083 01:39:48,190 --> 01:39:51,318 ♪ You gotta sway me now ♪ 1084 01:39:51,401 --> 01:39:53,778 ♪ Come on, babe ♪ 1085 01:39:53,862 --> 01:39:55,738 ♪ Come on, babe ♪ 1086 01:39:55,822 --> 01:40:00,322 ♪ Sway, sway, take me ♪ 1087 01:40:06,374 --> 01:40:08,834 ♪ Sway me ♪
